verses.esv: 43 “For no good tree bears bad fruit, nor again does a bad tree bear good fruit,
verses.kjv: 43 For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
verses.niv: 43 "No good tree bears bad fruit, nor does a bad tree bear good fruit.

verses.esv: 7 For the mind that is set on the flesh is hostile to God, for it does not submit to God’s law; indeed, it cannot.
verses.kjv: 7 Because the carnal mind is enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be.
verses.niv: 7 the sinful mind is hostile to God. It does not submit to God's law, nor can it do so.

verses.esv: 16 So then it depends not on human will or exertion, but on God, who has mercy.
verses.kjv: 16 So then it is not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that sheweth mercy.
verses.niv: 16 It does not, therefore, depend on man's desire or effort, but on God's mercy.

verses.esv: 2:1 And you were dead in the trespasses and sins
verses.kjv: 1 And you hath he quickened, who were dead in trespasses and sins;
verses.niv: 1 As for you, you were dead in your transgressions and sins,

verses.esv: 13 And you, who were dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses,
verses.kjv: 13 And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, hath he quickened together with him, having forgiven you all trespasses;
verses.niv: 13 When you were dead in your sins and in the uncircumcision of your sinful nature, God made you alive with Christ. He forgave us all our sins,

verses.esv: 18 A healthy tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a diseased tree bear good fruit.
verses.kjv: 18 A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
verses.niv: 18 A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, and a bad tree cannot bear good fruit.

verses.esv: 14 The natural person does not accept the things of the Spirit of God, for they are folly to him, and he is not able to understand them because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.kjv: 14 But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.niv: 14 The man without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him, and he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned.

verses.esv: 3 And even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing. 4 In their case the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelievers, to keep them from seeing the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.
verses.kjv: 3 But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost: 4 In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.
verses.niv: 3 And even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing. 4 The god of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers, so that they cannot see the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.

verses.esv: 20 For everyone who does wicked things hates the light and does not come to the light, lest his works should be exposed.
verses.kjv: 20 For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.
verses.niv: 20 Everyone who does evil hates the light, and will not come into the light for fear that his deeds will be exposed.

verses.esv: 27 All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.
verses.kjv: 27 All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him.
verses.niv: 27 "All things have been committed to me by my Father. No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.

verses.esv: 12 But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God, 13 who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God.
verses.kjv: 12 But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name: 13 Which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
verses.niv: 12 Yet to all who received him, to those who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God-- 13 children born not of natural descent, nor of human decision or a husband's will, but born of God.

verses.esv: 16 And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper, to be with you forever, 17 even the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it neither sees him nor knows him. You know him, for he dwells with you and will be in you.
verses.kjv: 16 And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever; 17 Even the Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth him not, neither knoweth him: but ye know him; for he dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.
verses.niv: 16 And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Counselor to be with you forever-- 17 the Spirit of truth. The world cannot accept him, because it neither sees him nor knows him. But you know him, for he lives with you and will be in you.

verses.esv: 27 John answered, “A person cannot receive even one thing unless it is given him from heaven.
verses.kjv: 27 John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.
verses.niv: 27 To this John replied, "A man can receive only what is given him from heaven.

verses.esv: 44 (For Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in his own hometown.)
verses.kjv: 44 For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.
verses.niv: 44 (Now Jesus himself had pointed out that a prophet has no honor in his own country.)

verses.esv: 4 But to this day the LORD has not given you a heart to understand or eyes to see or ears to hear.
verses.kjv: 4 Yet the LORD hath not given you an heart to perceive, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day.
verses.niv: 4 But to this day the LORD has not given you a mind that understands or eyes that see or ears that hear.

verses.esv: 34 You brood of vipers! How can you speak good, when you are evil? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks. 35 The good person out of his good treasure brings forth good, and the evil person out of his evil treasure brings forth evil.
verses.kjv: 34 O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh. 35 A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.
verses.niv: 34 You brood of vipers, how can you who are evil say anything good? For out of the overflow of the heart the mouth speaks. 35 The good man brings good things out of the good stored up in him, and the evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in him.

verses.esv: 13 As the proverb of the ancients says, ‘Out of the wicked comes wickedness.’ But my hand shall not be against you.
verses.kjv: 13 As saith the proverb of the ancients, Wickedness proceedeth from the wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.
verses.niv: 13 As the old saying goes, 'From evildoers come evil deeds,' so my hand will not touch you.

verses.esv:
23   Can the Ethiopian change his skin
    or the leopard his spots?
  Then also you can do good
    who are accustomed to do evil.
verses.kjv: 23 Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.
verses.niv: 23 Can the Ethiopian change his skin or the leopard its spots? Neither can you do good who are accustomed to doing evil.

verses.esv: 21 And you, who once were alienated and hostile in mind, doing evil deeds,
verses.kjv: 21 And you, that were sometime alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now hath he reconciled
verses.niv: 21 Once you were alienated from God and were enemies in your minds because of your evil behavior.

verses.esv:
4   In the pride of his face the wicked does not seek him;
    all his thoughts are, “There is no God.”
verses.kjv: 4 The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
verses.niv: 4 In his pride the wicked does not seek him; in all his thoughts there is no room for God.

verses.esv:
7   There is no one who calls upon your name,
    who rouses himself to take hold of you;
  for you have hidden your face from us,
    and have made us melt in the hand of our iniquities.
verses.kjv: 7 And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.
verses.niv: 7 No one calls on your name or strives to lay hold of you; for you have hidden your face from us and made us waste away because of our sins.

verses.esv:
65:1   I was ready to be sought by those who did not ask for me;
    I was ready to be found by those who did not seek me.
  I said, “Here I am, here I am,”
    to a nation that was not called by my name.
verses.kjv: 1 I am sought of them that asked not for me; I am found of them that sought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto a nation that was not called by my name.
verses.niv: 1 "I revealed myself to those who did not ask for me; I was found by those who did not seek me. To a nation that did not call on my name, I said, 'Here am I, here am I.'

verses.esv:
11     no one understands;
    no one seeks for God.
verses.kjv: 11 There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.
verses.niv: 11 there is no one who understands, no one who seeks God.

verses.esv: 18 For the word of the cross is folly to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
verses.kjv: 18 For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.
verses.niv: 18 For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.

verses.esv: 5 even when we were dead in our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ—by grace you have been saved—
verses.kjv: 5 Even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together with Christ, (by grace ye are saved;)
verses.niv: 5 made us alive with Christ even when we were dead in transgressions--it is by grace you have been saved.

verses.esv: 65 And he said, “This is why I told you that no one can come to me unless it is granted him by the Father.”
verses.kjv: 65 And he said, Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.
verses.niv: 65 He went on to say, "This is why I told you that no one can come to me unless the Father has enabled him."

verses.esv: 22 For Jews demand signs and Greeks seek wisdom, 23 but we preach Christ crucified, a stumbling block to Jews and folly to Gentiles, 24 but to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.
verses.kjv: 22 For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom: 23 But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness; 24 But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.
verses.niv: 22 Jews demand miraculous signs and Greeks look for wisdom, 23 but we preach Christ crucified: a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles, 24 but to those whom God has called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.
